channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Stocks for the Long Run? Setting the Record Straight
item.description: Stocks are a good investment long-term, providing that you dial in your expectations. New historical findings provide a richer, more complete understanding of international returns.

item.title: Renault links up with Chinese partner to build $22,000 EV after VW broadside
item.description: Renault CEO Luca de Meo was critical of Volkswagen after talks over a joint affordable EV imploded.

item.title: Rethinking Retirement Planning Amidst Aging Demographic Frontiers
item.description: Forward-thinking approaches to policy and wealth management are needed to ensure a better financial future across generations and income brackets.

item.title: Lab-grown meat isn’t on grocery store shelves yet, but Florida and Arizona have already banned it
item.description: Some cultivated meat companies say they’re considering legal action, and some states—like Tennessee—shelved proposed bans after lawmakers argued they would restrict consumers’ choices.

item.title: Book Review: The New World Economy in 5 Trends
item.description: A diligent economist and an eclectic bookworm serve up an analysis of megatrends that will have the greatest impact on economies and investments: innovation, productivity, climate, multiglobalization, debt, and aging.

item.title: Women’s health has been ignored for most of history. Here’s why that’s changing—and why it’s time to double down
item.description: Women’s health could be poised to enter an era of equity—but only if founders, funders, and public partners continue to support innovation.

item.title: Factor Strategies Belong in Your Completion Portfolio Toolkit
item.description: Why wouldn't you include factor strategies in your completion portfolio? A review of the two commonly used approaches for managing institutional assets highlights their symbiotic nature.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg’s request to be dropped from a Meta lawsuit is granted by New Mexico judge
item.description: The case is one of many filed by states, school districts and parents against Meta and its platforms over concerns about child exploitation.

item.title: For the Analyst: Peer Benchmarking Methods to Improve Earnings Forecasts
item.description: Peer benchmarking is a vexing task for financial analysts but one that is critical for forecasting earnings. This straightforward measure can help find peers for relative performance, compensation, and valuation benchmarking.

item.title: Amazon gets FAA approval to expand Prime Air drone deliveries for online orders
item.description: Amazon said that the FAA has given its Prime Air delivery service the OK to operate drones “beyond visual line of sight,” removing a barrier that has prevented its drones from traveling longer distances.
